intro: Acinodendron leucocarpum, commonly known as the white-fruited acinodendron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns white when mature, giving the plant its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
